intro: Mollinedia dolichotricha, commonly known as the long-hair sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, triangular leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along riverbanks. Mollinedia dolichotricha produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family.
